text: The Cuban Olympic Committee () is the organization that represents Cuban athletes in the International Olympic Committee (IOC), the Pan American Games and the Central American and Caribbean Games. It was created in Havana in 1926; however, it was not formally recognized by the IOC until 1955. The organization is currently directed by José Fernández Álvarez. The Cuban Olympic Committee is headquartered in Havana, Cuba. == Related pages == * Cuba at the Olympics ==References== ==Other websites== * www.olympic.org/cuba Category:1920s establishments in North America Category:Sports organizations of North America Category:Organizations based in Cuba
title: Cuban Olympic Committee
